net.proteusframework.core.hibernate

Interface HibernateSessionAcceptor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HibernateSessionHelper

    public interface HibernateSessionAcceptor
    Interface for objects that accept a hibernate Session that is managed outside of the scope of the application. This allows a servlet container to use a single Session per request or a standalone application to use one Session without changes to the application or module code.

    If an instance that implements this interface is going to be used across threads then the implementation MUST guarentee not to use the hibernate Session across threads. For example, the Session should be kept in a thread local and the mechanism that sets the session must be aware the session must be set for each thread.

    See HibernateSessionHelper for easy implementation of this interface.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearSession()
      Clear an existing session.
      Session getSession()
      Get the session.
      void setSession(Session session)
      Set the session.

    • Method Detail

      • clearSession

        void clearSession()
        Clear an existing session. The session should not be closed. No exception should be thrown if no session is set.

      • getSession

        Session getSession()
                   throws IllegalStateException
        Get the session.
        Returns:
        Session.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no session is set.

      • setSession

        void setSession(Session session)
        Set the session. The session should be set in a thread local. If there is an existing session, it should be closed and replaced with this session.
        Parameters:
        session - the session.
